timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we could use NewInstance instead of Reset and get rid of the method substitution.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I remove the method and switch to NewInstance and got the following error:
Caused by: com.oracle.svm.core.jdk.UnsupportedFeatureError: Code that was considered unreachable by closed-world analysis was reached. The call to java.util.Random.nextInt(int) is not reachable.
        at com.oracle.svm.core.util.VMError.unsupportedFeature(VMError.java:86)
        at com.oracle.svm.core.snippets.SnippetRuntime.unsupportedFeature(SnippetRuntime.java:153)
        at liquibase.util.StringUtil.randomIdentifer(StringUtil.java:498)
        at liquibase.Scope.enter(Scope.java:191)
replies.author: andrejpetras

replies.bodyText: @gsmet do you have any suggestion how to get rid of the method?
replies.author: andrejpetras

replies.bodyText:
@galderz any hint?
Apparently, if we use RESET we get a NPE and we have to reimplement the method using a local SecureRandom which is not very efficient. This looks a bit odd to me, I would have expected RESET to initialize the field properly.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: @galderz any chance you could have a look at this? Or have someone with native image knowledge to have a look? Thanks!
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
I wasn't exactly sure this class would exist in its current form with GraalVM doing its magic. That's why I did it this way.
I can try the other way though and see if it works.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: It worked so I pushed an update.
replies.author: gsmet
